statement:
Let $\mathcal F$ be a sheaf on a topological space $X$ and
$\mathcal U=\{U_i\}$ an open cover of $X$. If $\mathcal F$ is on every
of elements of $\mathcal U$, then
$$\check H^q(\mathcal U,\mathcal F)=\check H^q(X,\mathcal F),$$ where
$\check H^q(\mathcal U,\mathcal F)$ is the $q$-th of $\mathcal F$ with
respect to the open cover $\mathcal U$.

[9]{} Bonavero, Laurent. *Cohomology of Line Bundles on Toric Varieties,
Vanishing Theorems.* Lectures 16-17 from “Summer School 2000: Geometry
of Toric Varieties.”
